name: UC San Diego Class of 2020
description: I started programming in Middle school with Scratch (see 'Games'), and since then I've been improving my ability to use programming to solve problems. From computer science tutoring & courses in AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision & Computer Security at UC San Diego to frontend & backend app development to virtual reality to DevOps; I'm always looking to expand my skillset and do interesting work along the way!

name: Mitchell International
description: I developed a C# .NET tool to automate major branch releases
Wrote logic to pull Nuget, NPM & Maven packages from a TFS repository, build a dependency graph, update packages in topological order, and push to a frozen branch
Configured Docker image for Windows container to run project on AWS ECS
Reduced major release build time from ~3 days to ~3 hours

name: Triton Software Engineering
description: I lead a team of 4 React Native developers to design and write iOS/Android apps in TypeScript for nonprofits
Interface with medical customers and design collaborators to finalize functionality and design
Determine application architecture and team roles, workflow & tasks

name: Virtual Reality Medical Center
description: I developed Unity3D virtual reality projects to help patients cope with phobias in immersive environments
Wrote C# scripts, a custom shader in ShaderLab, and tweaked legacy animations

name: UCSD Computer Science & Engineering Department
description: I tutor students in Java and C++ on how to design, write, and debug object-oriented programs
Lead lab sections, speak publicly at assignment discussion, and collaborate on tasks with other tutors

name: UCSD Summer Program for Incoming Students
description: I started as a student and wrote Python scripts to implement finite state machine logic on a Raspberry Pi and implemented image manipulation and vector correlation for an optical character recognition program
I returned the next Summer as a mentor to teach students how to use Python to make Flask web applications, OpenCV robotics, and NumPy data science

name: Boys & Girls Club of America Volunteer Instructor
description: I taught a beginnerâ€™s programming class using Scratch
Helped students do experiments in a STEM workshop class and tutored students in mathematics

name: MechSuit VR
description: A Unity3D virtual reality game where you pilot an agile MechSuit for fight and flight in futuristic combat arenas!
Work in progress, coming soon to Oculus and Steam!
